telephony_line_assist_troubleshooting_au: Automatic reconfiguration of your device
We will automatically reconfigure your hardware.
Enter the IP address of your device in order to start the reboot.
Telephone reconfiguration.
Please restart your device.
After the boot phase, your device should connect to the OVHcloud network and be operational again.
The last known IP address for the device has been entered.
For your information, the IP address that you use to log in to the Manager is: {{ ip }} ({{ domain }}).
Consider checking that the connection is the same as your telephone system.
Device public IP address:
Please specify a valid IPv4 address (format: xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx).
IP address
Oops! An error occurred while automatically reconfiguring your device. Please try again or contact support.
Resetting your device.
In order to generate the configuration for your phone, we are going to reset it.
When the phone has started up, press the OK button for 10 seconds.
A window will appear asking you to confirm the factory reset, confirm by pressing OK again.
The terminal is restarting. You can now continue to step 2: automatic reconfiguration of the terminal.
When the phone has started up, keep pressing the OK button to enter the menu.
When the menu appears, select “Reset Base” and confirm.
The terminal is restarting. You can now continue to step 2: automatic reconfiguration of the terminal.
Verification of your phone’s MAC address
Please check that your phone’s MAC address is: {{ macAddress }}
This is located on the back of your phone
This is located on the base, on the rear side of your phone
Telephone reconfiguration.
On the phone terminal, press the black central button.
Go to Settings.
Go to Telephony.
Go to Assist VOIP.
Enter your PIN (default is 0000).
Select the IP1 account.
When the handset asks if you have a self-configuration code, press yes.
Enter the following auto-configuration code: {{ code }}
Press OK.
